whatIsAcookie.title: What is a cookie?
content: A cookie is a small amount of information that is sent by a website and information about your visit will be remembered, generally technical information, statistical information, personal preferences, etc. but never sensitive data or information. Cookies cannot damage your device and play an important role, since without them, using the web would be a more frustrating experience.

typeOfCookies.title: Types of cookies
content: The law allows us to store cookies on your device if they are strictly necessary for the operation of our site (these are the so-called technical cookies). For all other types of cookies, we need your permission. In addition to technical cookies, at {domain} we use analytical and advertising cookies. Some cookies are placed by third-party services with which we collaborate. These types of cookies are detailed in the Cookie Configurator, where you can change or withdraw your consent at any time. In addition to their purpose, cookies can also be:
Depending on who these cookies belong to:
Own cookies: those managed and sent to you directly by ONE SPAIN INSURANCE RISK MANAGEMENTS.
From third parties: those managed and sent to you by other ONE SPAIN INSURANCE RISK MANAGEMENTS employees.
Depending on how long these cookies last:
Session cookies: they only work while you are visiting our website and once you leave this page, they stop working.
Persistent cookies: they work after you have left our website for a specific time defined by the person responsible for the cookie.
The following are all the cookies used in ONE SPAIN INSURANCE RISK MANAGEMENT:

deleteCookies.title: How to deactivate or delete cookies
content: You can withdraw or change your consent at any time through the Cookie Configurator, which you can access at any time from the link in this policy in the case of the website. But we also remind you that, on the web, you can modify your browser settings, in the “options” or “preferences” section of your browser menu, where you can delete all cookies that would have been previously accepted. We recommend that you use the “Help” function of your browser to check how you can delete cookies.

content.name: Cookie number
content.description: Description

content.name: ASP.NET_SessionId
content.description: Required to run the application

content.name: CJSession
content.description: Grants a random and encrypted value to users (ID value) that allows them to be identified as unique users without processing personal identifying data

content.name: ExpirySession
content.description: Allows you to check if a user is still active after an hour

content.name: GASession
content.description: It allows the ID value of the CJSession cookie to be transferred to Google Analytics

content.name: UserTracker
content.description: Contains the first session ID of a user on the first visit to the web

content.name: UserType
content.description: It allows to identify if a user returns or visits the website for the first time

content.name: __utmz
content.description: Allows you to obtain the user's navigation point of origin

content.name: Cookie_rst
content.description: Allows you to display the warning banner and cookie information

content.name: Consent
content.description: It allows to identify if the user has given consent to cookies

content.name: isSessionReset
content.description: It allows you to track if the user's session has changed or has been renewed

content.name: CARCJ Session ID
content.description: Grants a random and encrypted value to users (ID value) for the car insurance product that allows them to be identified as unique users without processing personal identification data

content.name: QPE8D4CCA2E2E9
content.description: It allows users who have arrived at the pricing page to return to it if they press the “Back” button

content.name: HealthQuotePage
content.description: It allows users who have reached the pricing page in the health insurance product to return to it by pressing the “Back” button

content.name: captchav3_{Session ID}
content.description: Allows you to verify if the Captcha (application for identifying robots) information has been saved for a session ID

content.name: ip_{cookie ID}
content.description: Allows you to verify if the IP address for a cookie ID has been saved

content.name: Userinformation
content.description: It allows the user's IP information to be saved on the sales page

content.name: Last_Quote
content.description: It allows users to verify the prices obtained in the last comparison and recalculate them without answering all the questions again

content.name: CJSession
content.description: Grants a random and encrypted value to users (ID value) that allows them to be identified as unique users without processing personal identifying data

content.name: ExpirySession
content.description: Allows you to check if a user is still active after an hour

content.name: GASession
content.description: It allows the ID value of the CJSession cookie to be transferred to Google Analytics

content.description: Description

content.name: _ga
content.description: Used to monitor the availability of web pages

content.name: _glc_au
content.description: Used by Google AdSense to experiment with advertising efficiency on websites that use its services

content.name: _dc_gtm_UA-7713710-1
content.description: It is used to limit the percentage of requests that the browser makes to Google's servers.

content.name: _gid
content.description: It is used to distinguish some users from others without identifying them.

content.name: _gat_UA-7713710-1
content.description: Used by Google AdSense to experiment with advertising efficiency on websites that use its services

content.name: _gac_ua-7713710-1
content.description: Includes campaign information related to the user

content.name: vtstep
content.description: Used to track users and understand how many end up in sales

content.name: Datadome
content.description: Used to detect robots and DDoS attacks

content.name: Cookie number
content.description: Description

content.name: Conversion, IDE, ANID, DSID, FLC, AID, TAID, exchange_uid
content.description: They are used to serve targeted ads across the web. Targeted ads may be shown to you based on your previous visits to this website.

content.name: AID, DSID, TAID
content.description: They are used to link your activity on devices. In this way, the ads that appear in them are coordinated and we measure the conversion events

content.name: _fbc
content.description: It is used to deliver ads, measure their results and improve their relevance

content.name: _fbp
content.description: Identifies browsers to provide advertising and website analysis services

content.name: _uetmslkid
content.description: It is used to accurately measure conversions because it assigns a unique ID to each click on the ad and landing page

content.name: _uetsid
content.description: It is used to improve the accuracy of conversions. Bing? thanks to the fact that it assigns a unique ID to each session.

content.name: WE
content.description: It is used to measure unique Microsoft users.

content.name: MUIDB
content.description: It is used to measure unique Microsoft users. This cookie is used to restore the unique ID that the MUID cookie manages

content.name: Obuid
content.description: Native Ads platform: The user's anonymous ID is saved to record actions, such as clicks, conversions, etc.

content.name: t_gid
content.description: Native Ads platform: unique user ID to assign attribution (clicks, conversions...)

content.name: obuid
content.description: Native Ads platform: The user's anonymous ID is saved to record actions, such as clicks, conversions, etc.

content.name: Fr
content.description: This is Facebook's main advertising cookie. Used to deliver, analyze, and improve the relevance of ads

content.name: oo
content.description: Used to record decisions to stop receiving advertising

content.name: would
content.description: Used to open a specific location in an advertiser's application after installation
